issue.title: C++: API documentation using Doxygen
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-96](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-96). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For the developers using Arrow via C++, we should provide an automatically generated API documentation via doxygen.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-96?focusedCommentId=15510985) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Currently we're using `//` for code comments. As far as I know doxygen, code comments that should be included in the API docs should have a more "special" comment, e.g. `///` or `/** */` (see https://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/manual/docblocks.html).

`[~wesmckinn]` I'm happy with any of them. You had some preference if I remember correctly? I would also use the same choice then for parquet-cpp.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-96?focusedCommentId=15534318) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
`///` sounds fine to me. Once we get a docs build up we can start being more diligent about writing API documentation

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-96?focusedCommentId=15822161) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
